content:
Yes, you can change the URL of your Flask web app by specifying a different value for the `host` and `port` parameters when you run the `app.run()` function in your Flask application.

Here's an example:
```python
from flask import Flask

app = Flask(__name__)

# Define your Flask routes here

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(host='localhost', port=8080)
```
In the above code, you can change `host='localhost'` to `host='medicalsite'` or any other name you want to use as your hostname, and you can change `port=8080` to any other number you want to use as your port number.

So, for example, if you want your Flask app to run on the URL `http://medicalsite:8080/`, you would change the `app.run()` line to:
```arduino
app.run(host='medicalsite', port=8080)
```
Note that you may need to update your `/etc/hosts` file or DNS settings to ensure that the new hostname is properly mapped to your local IP address.
